Implement unit capture system in Lab Mode
description:
Implement the unit capture mechanic allowing players to take control of enemy units in Lab Mode.

## Game Rules (from docs/01-RULES.md)

### Capture Rule (Section 6.4)
Two combat units can **capture** an enemy unit by moving adjacent to it.

**Requirements**:
- Both attackers must be adjacent to target
- All involved units (2 attackers + target) must be free from enemy fire
- Cost: 1 AP total

**Effects**:
- Unit immediately changes ownership
- New owner can use it that same turn
- Transporter contents are captured with it

## Combat Units That Can Capture
- Tank
- Super Tank  
- Motor Boat
- Tower (if adjacent, which is rare given they're on Astronef)

## UI Requirements
1. **Capture Mode**: Toggle or automatic detection when conditions met
2. **Adjacency Check**: Highlight when 2 combat units are adjacent to same enemy
3. **Fire Zone Check**: Verify no unit is under enemy fire (within range of 2+ enemy combat units)
4. **Capture Indicator**: Visual feedback showing capture is possible
5. **Ownership Transfer**: Animate color change on captured unit
6. **AP Tracking**: Deduct 1 AP for capture action
7. **Cargo Transfer**: Handle transporter contents on capture

## Implementation Steps
1. Add adjacency helper function to hex utils
2. Create "under fire" zone calculation
3. Detect capture opportunity when 2 combat units adjacent to enemy
4. Add capture mode toggle or auto-detection
5. Implement capture action with ownership transfer
6. Handle transporter cargo on capture
7. Update unit colors/indicators on capture
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Detect when 2 friendly combat units are adjacent to same enemy unit
- [ ] Verify capture conditions (not under enemy fire)
- [ ] Display capture indicator when capture is possible
- [ ] Execute capture with 1 AP cost
- [ ] Transfer unit ownership with visual feedback
- [ ] Handle transporter cargo transfer on capture
- [ ] Touch-friendly controls (min 44px buttons)
- [ ] New owner can use captured unit same turn

title: Lab Mode: Setup mode and Play simulation mode with touch support
description:
Enhance Lab Mode with two distinct modes and full touch device support:

## Setup Mode (current + improvements)
- Place Astronef (4 hexes) on valid terrain (plain/marsh only)
- Deploy units from Astronef to adjacent hexes (arrival zone)
- Rotate units before placement (tap to rotate on touch)
- Visual feedback for valid/invalid placement zones

## Play Simulation Mode (new)
- Simulate a player turn with 15 AP
- Unit selection: tap unit to select, show action menu
- Movement: tap destination hex, show path preview with AP cost
- Load/Unload: context menu on transporters (Barge/Crab/Converter)
- Combat: select 2 friendly units, then target hex for crossfire
- AP counter display with real-time updates
- End turn button to reset AP

## Touch Device Requirements
- All interactions must work with tap/touch (no hover states required)
- Long-press for context menus (rotate, load/unload options)
- Pinch-to-zoom already implemented
- Two-finger pan for scrolling
- Touch-friendly button sizes (min 44px)
- Visual feedback on touch (highlight selected hex/unit)

## Mode Switching
- Toggle button in control panel: "Setup" / "Play"
- Clear visual indicator of current mode
- Preserve placed units when switching modes

title: Implement game setup phases (Turn 1 Landing, Turn 2 Deployment)
description:
Implement the initial game setup phases for multiplayer:

## Turn 1: Landing Phase
- Each player has 3 minutes to choose landing zone
- Place Astronef (4 hexes) on valid terrain:
  - Plain or marsh hexes only
  - Cannot land adjacent to another player's landing zone
  - Must have viable exit paths
- Sequential player order (determined at game start)
- Validate landing zone boundaries (zones 1-8 on map)

## Turn 2: Deployment Phase  
- All players deploy simultaneously (3 min shared)
- Deploy starting force from Astronef to arrival zone:
  - 3 Towers (remain on Astronef turret hexes)
  - 1 Barge, 1 Crab, 1 Converter
  - 2 Motor Boats, 4 Tanks, 1 Super Tank
  - 1 Bridge
- Units must be placed in/adjacent to Astronef hexes
- Sea units in sea hexes, land units on land hexes

## State Transitions
- Landing → Deployment when all players placed Astronef
- Deployment → Playing (Turn 3) when timer expires or all ready
- Turn 3 starts with only 5 AP per player

title: Implement shooting/combat system in Lab Mode
description:
Implement the shooting/combat system allowing players to destroy enemy units in Lab Mode.

## Game Rules (from docs/01-RULES.md)
- **Destruction Rule**: A unit is destroyed when under simultaneous fire from 2 combat units of the same player
- **Cost**: 1 AP per shot (2 AP total = 2 shots to destroy)
- **Max shots**: Each combat unit may fire max 2 times per turn
- **Range**: Combat units can shoot over any obstacle (minerals, vehicles, mountains)

## Combat Unit Ranges
| Unit | Domain | Range | Mountain Bonus |
|------|--------|-------|----------------|
| Tank | Land | 2 hex | 3 hex range on mountain |
| Super Tank | Land | 3 hex | N/A |
| Motor Boat | Sea | 2 hex | N/A |
| Tower | Fixed | 2 hex | On Astronef only |

## UI Requirements
1. **Shooting Mode**: Toggle to enter shooting mode (vs movement mode)
2. **Unit Selection**: Select 2 friendly combat units for coordinated fire
3. **Range Visualization**: Display reachable/targetable hexes when 2 units selected
4. **Target Highlighting**: Show intersection of both units' ranges (valid targets)
5. **AP Tracking**: Deduct 2 AP when shot executed (1 AP per shooter)
6. **Shot Counter**: Track shots per unit (max 2 per turn)

## Implementation Steps
1. Add COMBAT_RANGES constant to shared/game/types.ts
2. Create hex range calculation function (respecting terrain and mountain bonus)
3. Add shooting mode toggle in Lab Mode UI
4. Implement multi-select for combat units
5. Calculate and visualize range intersection
6. Add shoot action with AP deduction
7. Track shots-per-unit-per-turn
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Combat units can be selected for shooting (Tank, Super Tank, Motor Boat, Tower)
- [ ] Selecting 2 combat units shows intersection of their firing ranges
- [ ] Valid targets (enemy units in range of both) are highlighted
- [ ] Shooting costs 2 AP total (1 per shooter)
- [ ] Each unit can fire max 2 times per turn
- [ ] Mountain bonus applies to Tanks (3 hex range on mountain)
- [ ] Touch-friendly controls (min 44px buttons)
- [ ] Visual feedback on successful shot
